May be used only once per Scene per Pok\u00e9mon .","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Duelist, Master Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon would gain Momentum while already at 6 Momentum"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.97"}}

Polar Vortex.embed: {"title":"Polar Vortex","description":"While this Stratagem is bound, your Pok\u00e9mon may activate Moves and Abilities as if they were in Hail.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Glacial Ice, Type-Linked Skill at Adept"},{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.125"}}

Major Gift - Mental Suggestion.embed: {"title":"Major Gift \u2013 Mental Suggestion","description":"Mental Suggestion requires both you and the Mewtwo you are bound to be in the same vicinity. Make a Focus check as if you were using Telepath. On a success, you instill a thought or action into the Target\u2019s mind as if it were one of their own. They may not immediately act on it, and will question it if it is too alien from how they would normally act, but the thought will persist as long as they are unaware of its origin.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Major Gift \u2013 Expanded Horizons"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily \u2013 Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.69"}}

Captured Momentum.embed:
{"title":"Captured Momentum","description":"Choose One Effect:
» You or your Pokémon gain a +2 bonus to their next Accuracy Roll during this combat.
» You subtract your highest Skill Rank out of Acrobatics, Athletics, Stealth, Survival, Guile, or Perception from your next Capture Roll during this combat.
» You gain 1 Temporary Action Point that disappears after one full round.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Advanced Capture Techniques Rank 2"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will — Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You successfully Capture a Pokémon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.78"}}

Style Expert.embed: {"title":"Style Expert","description":"Your Poke\u0301mon gain +2d6 to your chosen Contest Stat. These dice are counted as if coming from Poffins.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class][Branch]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"3 Poke\u0301mon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins OR Coordinator, 1 Poke\u0301mon with 3d6 in a specific certain Contest Stat from Poffins"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"},{"name":"Note","value":" When you take Style Expert, choose from Beauty, Cool, Cute, Smart, or Tough. This becomes your Chosen Contest Stat. You may take Style Expert multiple times, each time choosing a different Contest Stat."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.115"}}

Perfect Aim.embed: {"title":"Perfect Aim","description":" The next damaging attack the target performs before the end of your next turn automatically hits and ignores Defensive Abilities but deals damage as if it were resisted one step further than normal. You may still roll to trigger any Effect Ranges or Critical Hits. All targets of the attack may not activate any Blessings in response, and the attack may not be Intercepted or avoided in any way (ex: with Dodge, Shield Moves, etc).","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2013 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":" Your Poke\u0301mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.62"}}

Incandescence.embed: {"title":"Incandescence","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders] [Stratagem]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Brightest Flame, Type-Linked Skill at Expert"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2013 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Fire-Type Pok\u00e9mon"}],"description":"While this Feature is Bound, the target gains the Mixed Power Poke\u0301 Edge effect when using damaging Fire-Type Attacks. If the target already has Mixed Power, they instead add their entire Attack and Special Attack Stats to all damaging Fire-Type Attacks, instead of one or the other. This does not stack with Twisted Power.","footer":{"text":"Sept.: p.9"}}

Lessons In Rage And Pain.embed: {"title":"Lessons In Rage and Pain","description":"While you have at least 1 Injury, add +X to your Damage Rolls with Rage, Flail, Fury Swipes, Thrash, and Weapon Attacks. X is equal to your Intimidate Rank plus the number of Injuries you have. You do not lose Hit Points from being Heavily Injured, and Injuries beyond the 5th do not lower your Maximum Hit Points.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Berserker, Adept Intimidate"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.49"}}

Major Gift - He Who Cannot Be Shackled.embed: {"title":"Major Gift \u2013 He Who Cannot Be Shackled","description":"Trigger: You become Trapped, Slowed, Tripped or Grappled.","fields":[{"name":"Effect","value":"You evade the Status Effect or Combat Maneuver."},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Minor Gift \u2013 World Serpent\u2019s Embrace"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2013 Free Action"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.68"}}

Bring It On!.embed:
{"title":"Bring it On!","description":"You may trigger Bring It On! whenever...
» A Cheered Ally takes Damage, to grant them 5 Damage Reduction agains the triggering Damage.
» A Cheered Ally makes a Save Check, to grant them a +2 Bonus on that check.
» A Cheered Ally Takes a Breather, to grant them Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank. A target may benefit from each "Bring It On!" effect only once per Scene.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Cheers, Adept Charm"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP — Free Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept.: p.3"}}

Fountain of Life.embed: {"title":"Fountain of Life","description":"You may choose to take a penalty to the Damage Roll for the attack up to triple your Type-Linked Skill Rank or up to half the rolled damage for the triggering attack, whichever is lower. Your Pok\u00e9mon gains twice that value in Temporary Hit Points and may cure themselves of one Status Affliction. Fountain of Life may only be used once per Scene per Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Flood!, Type-Linked Skill at Expert"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Water-Type Pok\u00e9mon hits with a damaging Water-Type attack"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.128"}}

Tough as Schist.embed: {"title":"Tough as Schist","description":"While this Feature is Bound, allied Stealth Rock Hazards within 4 meters of your Pok\u00e9mon are not used when a foe triggers them unless you want them to be. Whenever the target takes Super-Effective Damage from a Water, Grass, Ground, Fighting, or Steel Type Attack, they may consume an allied Stealth Rock Hazard within 4 meters to create temporary armor that grants them Damage Reduction equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank for one full round.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Gravel Before Me, Type-Linked Skill at Expert"},{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Rock-Type Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.127"}}

Champ in the Making.embed: {"title":"Champ in the Making","description":"Choose two Trained Stats for each Pok\u00e9mon instead of one. A Pok\u00e9mon may only have two Trained Stats this way.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Four Ace Trainer Feats, Master Command"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Drain 1 AP \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You use Ace Trainer to give Pok\u00e9mon Trained Stats"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.75"}}

Trapper.embed:
{"title":"Trapper","description":"You create a consumable item that creates 8 meters of Hazard within 6 meters. All 8 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of the Hazard. These Hazards cause foes that run into them to become Slowed until the end of their next turn and have an additional effect based on the terrain in which the item was made. When foes run into these Hazards, they are destroyed after their effects resolve. Pokémon and Trainers with Naturewalk for the terrains associated with a Hazard are immune to its effects. These items must be used the same day they are created or they lose all effect.
» Dust Trap — Grassland or Desert
» Tangle Trap — Forest or Wetlands
» Slick Trap — Ocean or Tundra
» Abrasion Trap — Mountain, Cave, or Urban","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Survivalist, Adept Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x2 — Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.149"}}

Lean In.embed: {"title":"Lean In","description":"Both you and your Mount Resist the attack one step further.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Ride as One"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You and your Mount both take Damage from a Burst, Blast, Cone, or Line"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.103"}}

Multi-Tasking.embed: {"title":"Multi-Tasking","description":"You may take two Standard Actions instead of one this turn, but both actions must have an At-Will Frequency.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"20 Speed Stat, Master Acrobatics"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Swift Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You gain Initiative."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.63"}}

Smashing Punishment.embed: {"title":"Smashing Punishment","description":"The Attack of Opportunity automatically hits, deals Fighting-Type Damage, and is a Critical Hit.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Close Quarters Mastery, Type-Linked Skill at Master"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"A Marked Foe provokes an Attack of Opportunity from your Fighting-Type Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.122"}}

Keep Fighting!.embed: {"title":"Keep Fighting!","description":"That Ally's Hit Point count is reduced to 1 instead, and then gains Temporary Hit Points equal to your Charm Rank doubled.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"5 Cheerleader Features, Master Charm"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon or an Ally Trainer with over 1 Hit Point is reduced to 0 Hit Points or lower"}],"footer":{"text":"Sept.: p.3"}}

Extreme Weather.embed:
{"title":"Extreme Weather","description":"The Weather is particularly intense and has additional effects.
» Hail
» Rain
» Sandstorm
» Sun","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Climate Control, Master Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 — Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You or your Pokémon create a Weather Condition"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.145"}}

Pain Resistance.embed: {"title":"Pain Resistance","description":"Your Pok\u00e9mon gains X Damage Reduction against the triggering attack, where X is its Tick Value multiplied by the number of Injuries it has. This may be triggered once per Scene per Pok\u00e9mon.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Taskmaster, Adept Intimidate"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon with 1 or more injuries takes Damage"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.105"}}

Walk It Off.embed: {"title":"Walk It Off","description":"Remove one Injury from yourself and regain 1\/4th of your maximum Hit Points. This Injury removal doesn't count against the natural healing limit on Injuries each day.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Adept Athletics, Novice Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily \u2014 Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.63"}}

Prehistoric Bond.embed: {"title":"Prehistoric Bond","description":"You also produce a Held Item from the remnants of the Fossil. The effect of this Held Item is based on the highest Base Stat of the individual Pok\u00e9mon being Revived, counting the effects of Nature but no other effects that alter Base Stats. If there is a tie, the GM decides which Base Stat is used. This Held Item may only be used by Pok\u00e9mon revived from Fossils","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Fossil Restoration, Expert Poke\u0301mon Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"The remains of a Fossil you revived"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.146"}}

Reliable Performance.embed: {"title":"Reliable Performance","description":"For appeal rolls, instead of making the Appeal Roll, you gain 1 Appeal Point for each Dice you would have rolled. For Accuracy Checks, act as if you had rolled a 10. For Skill Checks, multiply 3.5 by your Pok\u00e9mon's Skill Rank, and use the resulting number as the result of your roll, rounded down. For all rolls, add or subtract any modifiers as normal.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Nuanced Performance, Master Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon makes an Appeal Roll, Accuracy Check, or Skill Check"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.83"}}

Enchanting Gaze.embed: {"title":"Enchanting Gaze","description":"Choose a Manipulate Maneuver effect; apply that Effect to all foes in a Cone 2. This ignores Frequency Limitations with that Maneuver and automatically succeeds against all targets without an opposed roll.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Quick Wit, two Provocateur Skills at Expert Rank"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.167"}}

Overload.embed: {"title":"Overload","description":"While this Feature is Bound, whenever the target hits a foe with an Electric Attack, they may choose to have the foe lose Hit Points equal to the target's Tick value plus your Type-Linked Skill Rank. If they do, the target loses a Tick of Hit Points after the attack is resolved.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Lockdown, Type-Linked Skill at Adept"},{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.121"}}

Dabbler.embed: {"title":"Dabbler","description":"At the Level 5, 10, 20, 30, and 40 Character Advancement Level Milestones, if you choose to gain Bonus Stats, you also gain an Edge for which you qualify. If you choose Bonus Edges or Features, you also gain +2 to your choice of Attack or Special Attack. This applies retroactively.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Hobbyist, Expert General Education or Perception"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.86"}}

Dress to Impress.embed: {"title":"Dress to Impress","description":"Whenever you create an Incense Held Item, choose Sweet Scent or Aromatic Mist. While your Pok\u00e9mon is holding that Incense Item in an active Held Item slot, they add the chosen Move to their Move List.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Versatile Wardrobe, two Fashionista Skills at Expert"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Chic Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.137"}}

Species Savant.embed: {"title":"Species Savant","description":"When you take Species Savant, choose a single Evolutionary Family. Your Pok\u00e9mon of your Chosen Evolutionary Family have each of their Base Stats increased by +1.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"3 different individual Pok\u00e9mon of the same evolutionary line"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.59"}}

Directed Focus.embed: {"title":"Directed Focus","description":"Whenever your Pok\u00e9mon with the Exploit or Tolerance Ability are targeted by an [Order], deal Super- Effective Damage, or take Super-Effective Damage, they gain +1 Momentum after all effects of the Move or Order are resolved.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Effective Methods"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.96"}}

Nuanced Performance.embed: {"title":"Nuanced Performance","description":"That Move's Frequency is not expended. This does not work with Moves that may fail to activate, such as moves with the Execute keyword.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Coordinator, Expert Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon miss all targets with a Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.83"}}

Psionic Overload.embed:
{"title":"Psionic Overload","description":"The effect of this Feature depends on the Triggering Move.
» Kinesis
» Barrier
» Psychic
» Telekinesis","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Special Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"PK Omega, Master Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP — Swift Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You hit with Psychic or use another Telekinetic Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.191"}}

Potent Venom.embed: {"title":"Potent Venom","description":"The foe does not necessarily lose Special Defense Combat Stages from Poison; instead, they lose Combat Stages in the Combat Stat of your choice. Whenever the target loses Hit Points from Poison, they lose additional Hit Points equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Type Ace (Poison)"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Poison-Type Pok\u00e9mon inflicts Poison on a foe"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.126"}}

Pain Dampening.embed: {"title":"Pain Dampening","description":"Choose any number of Channeled Pok\u00e9mon, which must include the triggering Pok\u00e9mon. Instead of resolving the attack normally, divide the damage from the attack by the number of chosen Pok\u00e9mon. Each chosen Pok\u00e9mon then loses that many Hit Points. For each chosen Pok\u00e9mon that Resists or is Immune to the Type of the triggering attack, subtract your Intuition Rank from the damage of the attack before all calculations.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Channeler, Expert Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Channeled Pok\u00e9mon would be Fainted by a damaging attack"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.180"}}

Fistful of Force.embed: {"title":"Fistful of Force","description":"You may destroy the Shard to use the Move Judgment. Judgment's Type must be one of the Types associated with the used Shard. Instead of adding your Special Attack when using this attack, you may choose to add your Occult Education Rank tripled.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Crystal Artificer, Master Occult Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You must have a Shard in your Main Hand or Off-Hand to use Fistful of Force."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.142"}}

Athletic Moves.embed: {"title":"Athletic Moves","description":"You learn two Athlete Moves marked with the Rank of this Feature you are taking or lower.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Ranked 3][+HP]"},{"name":"Rank 1 Prerequisites","value":"Athlete"},{"name":"Rank 2 Prerequisites","value":" Athlete, Expert Athletics"},{"name":"Rank 3 Prerequisites","value":" Athlete, Master Athletics"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.155"}}

Innovation.embed: {"title":"Innovation","description":"The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a Move created with Innovation. See the next section for details on creating Moves for this Feature. A Pok\u00e9mon may only have one Move created by Innovation at a time.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Adaptable Performance"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Pok\u00e9mon with at least 1 Tutor Point."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.83"}}

Enticing Beauty.embed: {"title":"Enticing Beauty","description":"The target acts as a Bait item as if it had the Alluring Capability. Add its number of Beauty Dice from Poffins as a Bonus to all d20 lure rolls.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Beautiful Ballet Rank 1"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.115"}}

Sneak Attack.embed: {"title":"Sneak Attack","description":"While this Feature is bound, when attacking foes that are Fainted, Flanked, Flinched, Sleeping, Stuck, Tripped, unaware of your Pok\u00e9mon's presence, or otherwise do not expect an attack, the target gains a +2 bonus to Accuracy Rolls and a bonus to Damage Rolls equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Clever Ruse, Type-Linked Skill at Adept"},{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Dark-Type Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.120"}}

Type Ace.embed:
{"title":"Type Ace","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class] [Branch]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"2 Different Pokémon of the chosen Type, Type-Linked Skill at Novice
OR
Elemental Connection (of the chosen Type), 1 Pokémon of the chosen Type, Type-Linked Skill at Novice
See the attached image for details on the Type-Linked Skills."},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will – Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pokémon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining."}],"description":"The target loses 2 Tutor Points and learns the Last Chance or Type Strategist Ability for your Chosen Type. You may target a Pokémon only once with Type Ace.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.119"},"image":"https://imgur.com/7c6Egad.png"}

Overrun.embed: {"title":"Overrun","description":"Your Pok\u00e9mon adds their Speed Stat in addition to their normal attacking Stat to their Damage Roll. The target gains Damage Reduction against this attack equal to their own Speed Stat.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Conqueror\u2019s March, Expert Acrobatics or Athletics"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Mount with Run Up makes a Damage Roll for a Dash or Pass Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.103"}}

Encore Performance.embed: {"title":"Encore Performance","description":"Choose One: Your Pok\u00e9mon gains +1 Combat Stage in any Stat in which they haven't gained a Combat Stage this turn; or gains a second Standard Action this round that must be used to make an At-Will action that does not trigger Encore Peformance; or, if they are placing Hazards, they may place an additional two units; or, if they are activating a Weather Effect, it lasts an additional two turns; or, if they are activating a Blessing, it gains an additional use.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"3 Trickster Features, Expert Guile"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon uses a Status-Class Move that does not target foes."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.108"}}

Gale Strike.embed: {"title":"Gale Strike","description":"You may roll the Accuracy Check twice, and resolve using either result. If both results would hit and you resolve the attack using the lower result, Gale Strike's Frequency is not expended.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Celerity, Type-Linked Skill at Adept"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon uses a Flying-Type Move with an Accuracy Check"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.123"}}

Juggler.embed: {"title":"Juggler","description":"Using Quick Switch costs only 1 AP. Whenever you send a Pok\u00e9mon into an encounter from a Pok\u00e9 Ball, they receive a +10 bonus to their Initiative during that round.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class][+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Quick Switch, Novice Acrobatics, Novice Guile"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.101"}}

Ride as One.embed: {"title":"Ride as One","description":"While you are Mounted, you and your Mount each use the highest of each other's Speed Evasion. If both you and your Mount have the same Speed Evasion, you instead each receive a +1 bonus to Speed Evasion. Whenever one of you receives Initiative, either of you may take your turn. When the next person would receive initiative, the person that did not take their turn then takes it.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Rider"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.103"}}

Foiling Foliage.embed: {"title":"Foiling Foliage","description":"Pick a Grass-Type Status-Class Move known by the target. The chosen Move no longer takes up a Move Slot. A Pok\u00e9mon may have only one Move bypass the Move Limit at a time; if a new Move is chosen for a Pok\u00e9mon, the previous Move loses this effect.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Type Ace (Grass)"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon with a Grass-Type Status Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.124"}}

Clever Ruse.embed:
{"title":"Clever Ruse","description":"Your Pokémon may apply two of the effects below after the triggering attack is resolved. Your Pokémon may also take a Standard Action to trigger this Feature. This Feature may be triggered only once per round.
» They gain +4 Evasion for one full round.
» Their attacks ignore Evasion from Stats until the end of their next turn.
» They may immediately Disengage as a Free Action.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Type Ace (Dark)"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will — Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pokémon misses all targets with a Dark- Type attack on their turn"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.120"}}

Debilitate.embed: {"title":"Debilitate","description":"While this Feature is Bound, when the target sucessfully hits a Poisoned or Blighted foe with a Poison- Type Move, the foe gains a -2 penalty to Accuracy Rolls and Evasion for one full round.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Potent Venom, Type-Linked Skill at Adept"},{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Poison-Type Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.126"}}

Dune Walker.embed: {"title":"Dune Walker \u2013 Desert Terrain","description":"Your long hours in the unforgiving desert have made you inured to sand and heat. You\u2019re immune to the effects of Sandstorm, Sand-Attack, and Sand Tomb, and you gain 5 Damage Reduction against Fire-Type attacks.","fields":[{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.151"}}

Press On!.embed: {"title":"Press On!","description":"Your Hardened Pokemon gain the following benefits, based on your Intimidate Rank\n\u00bb Expert:When your Pokemon Faints, you may pay 1 AP. If you do, your Pokemon Faints at -30% Hit Points instead.\n\u00bb Master: While acting at 0 Hit Points or less, your Pokemon\u2019s Critical Hit, Effect Range, Evasion, Initiative, Damage Reduction, and Resistance Bonuses from being Hardened are doubled.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Taskmaster, Expert Intimidate"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"},{"name":"Note:","value":"Poke\u0301mon cannot use the Moves Explosion, Endure, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct while they have 0 Hit Points or less. Poke\u0301mon with the Soulless capability cannot benefit from Press On!"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.105"}}

Powerful Motivator.embed:
{"title":"Powerful Motivator","description":"Baby-Doll Eyes, Confide, Leer, and your Provocateur Moves gain additional effects. These effects occur whether the Move hits or misses.
» Baby-Doll Eyes
» Confide
» Leer
» Sweet Kiss
» Taunt
» Torment
» Lovely Kiss","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Provocateur, two Provocateur Skills at Adept Rank"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.166"}}

Quick Gymnastics.embed: {"title":"Quick Gymnastics","description":"You may may Shift 2 Meters. You don't count as Flanked or trigger Attacks of Opportunity until the end of your next turn. Additionally, if you activate this Feature, the triggering action does not provoke Attacks of Opportunity.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Tumbler"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You hit with an Attack; you make a Jump; or you stand up from being Tripped"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.173"}}

Surprise!.embed: {"title":"Surprise!","description":"Make two attack rolls for the triggering action, and use the better result to finalize the attack. If both attacks would hit, the target is Flinched. Surprise! may be used only once per Scene per target. If the triggering attack was a Pok\u00e9 Ball, Hand Net, Cap Cannon, or Struggle Attack, Surprise! costs 1 AP to activate; otherwise, it costs 2 AP.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Hunter, Adept Stealth or Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"X AP \u2014 Swift Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You make an attack against a foe that does not anticipate an attack or is adjacent to your Pok\u00e9mon with Pack Hunt or Teamwork"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.159; May: p.11"}}

Chef.embed: {"title":"Chef","description":"You may use any Chef Recipe for which you qualify.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Basic Cooking, Novice Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.131"}}

Play Them Like a Fiddle.embed:
{"title":"Play Them Like a Fiddle","description":"The Move gains additional effects as listed below. You may use the effects of each Move only once per Scene.
» Baby-Doll Eyes
» Confide
» Leer
» Sweet Kiss
» Taunt
» Torment
» Lovely Kiss","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Powerful Motivator, a Provocateur Skill at Expert Rank"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x3 — Swift Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You hit with Leer, Confide, Baby-Doll Eyes, or a Provocateur Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.167"}}

Adrenaline Rush.embed: {"title":"Adrenaline Rush","description":"You gain +1 Combat Stage in each of your Trained Stats, are cured of up to two Status Afflictions, and gain a Tick of Temporary Hit Points. Adrenaline Rush may be used only once per Scene","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Athlete, Expert Athletics"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You are lowered to half or your Maximum Hit Points or less"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.155"}}

Dive (Feature).embed: {"title":"Dive (Feature)","description":"You may immediately Shift 1 Meter, and then become Tripped. This Feature cannot be used if you are Stuck, Grappled, or otherwise impaired from Shifting. This Feature causes you to dodge Ranged attacks aimed at you, and may let you avoid Cones, Bursts, Blasts, or Lines if the shift removes you from the area of effect.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Adept Acrobatics"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Shift Action, Interrupt"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You are targeted by a Ranged 1-Target Attack, or are in a Cone, Burst, Blast, or Line."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.63"}}

Stat Mastery.embed: {"title":"Stat Mastery","description":"Stat Mastery\u2019s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Branch]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Stat Maneuver"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"},{"name":"Attack Effect","value":" When your Poke\u0301mon successfully uses a Push, Disarm, or Dirty Trick Combat Maneuver, the target of the Maneuver loses a Tick of Hit Points."},{"name":"Defense Effect","value":" Whenever your Poke\u0301mon do not spend their Shift Action to Shift during a turn, they gain +5 Damage Reduction for one full round."},{"name":"Special Attack Effect","value":" The Range of your Poke\u0301mon\u2019s Special Non-Melee Moves is increased by +2.  is does not affect the size of Area-Of-Effect moves (But does affect the range at which you can place Ranged Blasts)."},{"name":"Special Defense Effect","value":" Whenever your Poke\u0301mon would lose a Tick of Hit Points from Status Aflictions, Weather, or other effects, they lose 5 fewer Hit Points, to a minimum of 1."},{"name":"Speed Effect","value":" Your Poke\u0301mon may take Disengage Maneuvers as Swift Actions."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.113"}}

Arcane Training.embed: {"title":"Arcane Training","description":"You may use Arcane Weapons. Attacks made with your Arcane Weapons share the Type of your Elemental Connection. If you have Mystic Senses, these Attacks deal Normal Type Damage. Arcane Weapon users that qualified through Mystic Senses or Elemental Connection (Normal) gain a +5 Bonus to Damage Rolls and a +2 Bonus to Effect Range when using Arcane Weapon Attacks. When wielding an Arcane Weapon, you may resist Disarm Maneuvers with your Occult Education.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Special Attack][Weapon]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Novice Occult Education, Elemental Connection or Mystic Senses"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.47"}}

Rule of Cool.embed: {"title":"Rule of Cool","description":"In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Cool Conduct Rank 1"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon uses a Cool-Type Move"},{"name":"In Battles","value":" The triggering Move's Crit Range is increased by 3, and the Moves with the Interrupt Keyword may not be activated in reaction to this Move. You may activate Rule of Cool only once per Pok\u00e9mon per Scene."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.116"}}

Dashing Makeover.embed: {"title":"Dashing Makeover","description":"When you activate Dashing Makeover, choose one Equipment or Held Item you can create. While this Feature is Bound, the target gains the effects of the chosen item, as long as they would normally be able to equip it (ex: Trainers cannot equip Incense Items).They do not need to take up an Equipment or Held Item slot to gain this benefit. A target may only be affected by one instance of Dashing Makeover at a time.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Fashionista"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Trainer or Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.137"}}

Sentry Runes.embed: {"title":"Sentry Runes","description":"The target Glyph becomes an Unown of your Trainer Level, its Stats allocated as you wish. This Unown knows a single instance of Hidden Power, identical to your own. The Glyph can fight on its own without needing you to command it. At the end of the encounter, or after 5 minutes, the Unown returns to Unown Space forever, destroying the Glyph. You may only have one Glyph active in this way at a time; if various Alarm Glyphs are triggered to become Sentries at the same time, only one does so; the others will do so once the previous one has been destroyed if the Trigger condition is still being met.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Attack or Special Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Expert Occult Education, Explosive Runes, Hidden Power"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Glyph you have put down, regardless of distance"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.52"}}

Crippling Shot.embed: {"title":"Crippling Shot","description":"Make a Ranged Struggle Attack attack with a -2 penalty to Accuracy. If you hit, the attack deals Damage as if it was resisted one step, but the target becomes Slowed, loses 1 Speed Combat Stage, and you initiate a Trip Maneuver against the target. You may use your Perception Skill to resolve the Opposed Check if you wish.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Attack][Weapon]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Marksman, Expert Perception or Combat"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP \u2014 Full Action"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.59"}}

Bottled Lightning.embed: {"title":"Bottled Lightning","description":"Choose one of your Electric Type Moves with a target. You Charge the target item with this Move. Bot- tled Lightning counts as using the Move for frequency purposes. You may expend this Charge as a Swift Ac- tion on your turn to use the Move the item was charged with, originating from the item. If a Pok\u00e9mon or Train- er touches a Charged item, you may instead activate this Swift Action as if it had the Priority keyword. At the end of a Scene, all items lose their Charge, and you may only have X items Charged at a time where X is half your Focus Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Storm Wizard Rank 1, Adept Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP - Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"An item made of conductive material"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.69"}}

Improvised Gadgets.embed: {"title":"Improvised Gadgets","description":"Choose one of the Capabilities listed in the Target line that the target Pok\u00e9mon has. You create a Main or Off-Hand Equipment Item usable by Trainers that grants the user the chosen Capability. Whenever a Trainer makes Struggle Attacks using Zapper through this Item, they may choose to use your Technology Education Rank tripled in place of an offensive Stat. When this Feature is Unbound, the Equipment Item breaks and cannot be repaired. You may only have X instances of this Feature Bound at once, where X is equal to half your Technology Education Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Gadgeteer Research Field, Novice Technology Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A willing Pok\u00e9mon with the Magnetic, Zapper, or Threaded Capability"}],"footer":{"text":"May: p.5"}}

Pact Gift - Hypergeometry.embed: {"title":"Pact Gift - Hypergeometry","description":"Static Effect: You may always treat the distance between you and any other Trainer or Pok\u00e9mon as one meter greater or one meter less as you choose for the purpose of calculating range or distance of travel. You may not use this to avoid melee attacks by switching between making their distance greater or less - a value is chosen when an action is announced and cannot be changed afterwards.\n\nScene Effect: You may activate this Pact Gift once per Scene when hit by a single target attack. The attack instead hits a target of your choice in an adjacent square to you.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"All MissingNo Major Gifts"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static | Scene - Standard Action, Interrupt"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.69"}}

Major Gift - Corrupt Existence.embed: {"title":"Major Gift - Corrupt Existence","description":"Target: Trainer or Pok\u00e9mon within 6 meters","fields":[{"name":"Effect","value":"For each AP spent on Corrupt Existence up to a maximum of 3, roll 1d20. The Target becomes one step weaker against a Type for each roll as follows: Bug on a result of 1; Dark on 2; Dragon on 3; Electric on 4; Fighting on 5; Fire on 6; Flying on 7; Ghost on 8; Grass on 9; Ground on 10; Ice on 11; Normal on 12; Poison on 13; Psychic on 14; Rock on 15; Steel on 16; Water on 17; and on a result of 18-20, reroll the 1d20. This effect lasts until the end of the encounter, even if the target is recalled."},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Minor Gift - Detect Heretic"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"X AP - Standard Action"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.70"}}

Adaptive Geography.embed: {"title":"Adaptive Geography","description":"The triggering target takes their turn as if they were in a terrain adjacent to the terrain they are in on the following graphic. For example, if you are standing in Wetlands terrain, you may act as if you are standing in Forest or Ocean Terrain. This affects Survivalist Features, Naturewalk Capabilities, Moves with the Environ Keyword, etc.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"4 Survivalist Features, Master Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You or your Pok\u00e9mon gain Initiative"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.150"}}

Ambient Aura.embed:
{"title":"Ambient Aura","description":"You gain an Aura Blessing that can be spent any time as a Free Action Interrupt. When you spend an Aura Blessing, you choose one of the effects below. You may only have one Aura Blessing at a time, and you must have the Aura Pulse Capability to use Ambient Aura.
» You create an energy barrier around you or an ally within 5 meters granting Damage Reduction equal to your Intuition Rank tripled until the end of your next turn.
» You cure yourself of a Volatile Status Affliction.
» Gain the Blindsense Capability until the end of the Scene.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Attack or Special Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Aura Reader, Expert Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 — Swift Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You use a Move with the Aura keyword"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.177"}}

Duelist.embed:
{"title":"Duelist","description":"The Foe becomes Tagged; or if the foe is already Tagged, the foe loses the Tag. Only one foe can be Tagged this way at a time. If a new Foe is Tagged, all other Tags are lost.
Your Pokémon under the effects of Focused Training gain half their Momentum (rounded up) as a Bonus to Accuracy and Evasion against Tagged Foes, but as long as a Foe is Tagged, they do not benefit from Focused Training's Accuracy Bonus against other foes.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Focused Training, Novice Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will — Swift Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Pokémon or Trainer"},{"name":"Mechanic – Momentum","value":"» Your Pokémon begins each Scene with 0 Momentum.
» At the end of each Combat round, your Pokémon gains +1 Momentum.
» Whenever your Pokémon hits a Tagged foe, they gain +1 Momentum.
» Your Pokémon has a maximum of 6 Momentum. So use a d6 to track it.
» All Momentum is lost when your Pokémon Faints, your Pokémon is recalled, or combat ends."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.96"}}

Soothing Connection.embed: {"title":"Soothing Connection","description":"Distribute 5 points in any way among Pok\u00e9mon you are Channeling. For each point you assign to a Channeled Pok\u00e9mon, they gain a Tick of Hit Points.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Pain Dampening, Master Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x2 \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Channeled Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.180"}}

Not Yet!.embed: {"title":"Not Yet!","description":"Before fainting, the targeted Pok\u00e9mon gains an Injury, and may then use a Move as an Interrupt. When the Move is resolved, the Pok\u00e9mon then immediately faints. This consumes a Pok\u00e9mon turn as normal. This cannot be used with the Moves Explosion, Pain Split, or Self-Destruct.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Enduring Soul, Expert Athletics or Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon is Fainted, but is not at less than -100% Hit Points."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.99"}}

Mentor.embed: {"title":"Mentor","description":"The target loses 1 Tutor Point, and then learns a move from its tutor list marked with a (N), or any move on its level-up list learned at X Level or lower, where X is the target's current Level plus the sum of your Mentor Skill Ranks. Note that despite being Tutored, these Moves count as if they were \"natural\" for organizational purposes.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Two of Charm, Intimidate, Intuition, or Poke\u0301mon Education at Novice Rank"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Pok\u00e9mon with at least 1 Tutor Point remaining"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.88"}}

Type Sync.embed: {"title":"Type Sync","description":"The Target gains the Type of your Elemental Connection as an additional Type, or has one of their Types replaced by that Type. See the Type Changes sec- tion (page 436) for more information and suggestions. A Pok\u00e9mon may be targeted by Type Sync only once. This Feature may be performed One Time for each Rank above Untrained you have of your highest of Medicine, Occult, or Tech Education, up to a maximum of 4 times at Master Rank.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Ranked 2][+Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Elemental Connection; a Type-Linked Class; Adept Medicine, Occult, or Tech Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Special \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.47"}}

Fabulous Max.embed: {"title":"Fabulous Max","description":"In Contests: Treat the Move as if it were one step more aligned with the Contest Type. If the Move would be opposing the Contest Type, it is instead neutral. If it is neutral, it is instead matching. You may activate this effect only once per Contest.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Beautiful Ballet Rank 1"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon uses a Beauty-Type Move"},{"name":"In Battles","value":" The move gains the keyword Burst 1 if Melee, or Blast 2 if ranged. If the move is already a Burst, Blast, or Cone, increase the size of the Move's Range by 1. This does not cause a target to be hit multiple times. You may activate Fabulous Max only once per Pok\u00e9mon per Scene."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.115"}}

Medicinal Blend.embed: {"title":"Medicinal Blend","description":"Ingredients: Two Restoratives, or a Restorative and an X-Item","fields":[{"name":"Effect","value":"You fuse the two Ingredients, creating an Item that has the properties of both. If you choose two Restoratives, they cannot be Restoratives with the same effect (you could not for example, mix a Potion and a Super Potion). If a Restorative Patch is used as an Ingredient, the resulting item can only be used as an Extended Action."},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Apothecary, Master Medicine Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"You or your Pok\u00e9mon make a roll"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.141"}}

Suggestion.embed: {"title":"Suggestion","description":"You smoothly plant a thought into the subject's head that lasts as long as this Feature is Bound. They won't know exactly why or how they thought of it; they will naturally assume they thought of it themselves, and their brain will attempt to get there as logically as it can. The target may not necessarily act on the Suggestion, especially if it is against their nature. Using Suggestion to plant a specific thought may cause the target to think about a specific subject, dredging up surface thoughts related to the matter. Using this on a target leaves discoverable psychic residue. You may only use Suggestion as long as you have the Telepathy Capability, though you may keep it Bound without having Telepathy active.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Special Defense]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Honed Mind, Master Focus or Intuition"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 1 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Pok\u00e9mon or Trainers"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.69"}}

Shared Senses.embed: {"title":"Shared Senses","description":"You Imprint the target for the duration of this Feature. You receive all sensory information being sensed by Imprinted Pok\u00e9mon, and Imprinted Pok\u00e9mon are not subject to the distance limit on Channeling. If you have Imprinted more than one Pok\u00e9mon, you may only concentrate on the senses of one Pok\u00e9mon at a time, and only choose one such Pok\u00e9mon per round. If you stop Channeling a Pok\u00e9mon, they are no longer Imprinted as well.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Channeler"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 1 AP \u2014 Swift Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Channeled Pok\u00e9mon"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.179"}}

Coaching.embed:
{"title":"Coaching","description":"Your Pokémon gains a bonus based on the type of Combat maneuver they are making. This Feature may be triggered once per Scene per Pokémon.
» Your Pokémon gains a +1d6 bonus to Opposed Acrobatics, Athletics, Combat, or Stealth Skill Checks. » If your Pokémon was Sprinting, they double their Movement Capabilities instead of increasing by 50%.
» If your Pokémon was making an Attack of Opportunity, they automatically hit.
» You may also activate this Feature to let them Intercept for any Ally regardless of Loyalty, and they automatically succeed on the Skill Check to do so.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+HP]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Training Regime"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"1 AP — Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pokémon makes a Combat Maneuver"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Pokémon makes a Combat Maneuver"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.155"}}

Aqua Vortex.embed: {"title":"Aqua Vortex","description":"Your Poke\u0301mon gains Damage Reduction against the attack equal to your Type-Linked Skill Rank. Additionally, calculate Type Effectiveness with this attack as if your Poke\u0301mon has no Typings besides Steel.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Polished Shine, Type-Linked Skill at Master"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2013 Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Steel-Type Poke\u0301mon is hit by a damaging attack"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.128"}}

Seed Bag.embed: {"title":"Seed Bag","description":"","fields":[{"name":"Rank 1 Prerequisites","value":"Botany Research Field, Green Thumb, Adept General Education or Adept Survival"},{"name":"Rank 2 Prerequisites","value":" Master General Education or Master Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"X Daily \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Willing Pok\u00e9mon"},{"name":"Rank 1 Effect","value":" You become adept at harvesting Seeds and Spores from Pok\u00e9mon. You may target a willing Grass-Type Pok\u00e9mon that knows Sleep Powder, Stun Spore, or Poison Powder. Add this move to your Move list for the remainder of the day. You may not use Seed Bag to have multiple instances of the same move in your Move list. Seed Bag may be used twice per day per Rank."},{"name":"Rank 2 Effect","value":" You may also harvest Cotton Spore, Leech Seed, Spore, or Worry Seed."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.143"}}

Glyph.embed: {"title":"Glyph","description":"You may set the target Unown against any flat surface, and turn the Unown into a glyph. Glyphs have HP equal to your Level, and no other stats. Glyphs last until they are destroyed or intentionally de-activated, at which time the Unown returns to Unown Space, dis- appearing forever. You may have a number of active Glyphs equal to your Occult Education Rank. When setting a Glyph, you may have the Glyphs be either visi- ble or invisible, as you prefer. At any time, as a Standard Action, you may Channel any Glyph youhave set down. This causes the Glyph's eye to open and become visi- ble if it was not. While you are channeling a Glyph, you are able to see through the Glyph, listen through it, and project your voice through it.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Attack or Special Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Rune Master"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Unown that is not part of a Prime Unown"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.51"}}

Playing God.embed:
{"title":"Playing God","description":"Choose Castform, Grimer, Koffing, Magnemite, Porygon, Solosis, Trubbish, or Voltorb. Using your chemistry set, you create an artificial Egg of the Chosen Pokémon, that hatches within a day. The resulting Pokemon is born at level 5, with the Nature and Ability of your choice (Abilities chosen from its species' Basic Abilities). Additionally, you may enhance the Pokemon in several ways. Choose a number of upgrades below equal to your Technology Education Rank.
» The Pokémon is of an unusual coloration, gaining a +2d6 Bonus to the Introduction Stage of a Contest toward a single Contest Stat.
The Pokémon adds a Move from its Egg Move or Move Tutor List to its Inheritance List. This may be performed up to 3 times.
» Increase one of the Pokémon's Base Stats by +1. This counts as use of a Vitamin. This may be performed up to 5 times.","fields":[{"name":"Cost","value":"$3500"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Chemist, Expert Technology Education"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will — Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.144"}}

Messiah.embed: {"title":"Messiah","description":"Your Connection with one of your Patrons has reached such a point that even you are capable of performing the miracles they are renowned and worshiped for. Expending a use of Messiah allows you to perform such a miracle. For example, in a Region where Shaymin is known to restore withered forests to their former glory, a Touched who is a Messiah of Shaymin might be able to cause a forest to start to rapidly recover from the a ermath of a wildfire. Such acts are usually, but not always, noticeably supernatural and divine.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[PATRON STAT]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Touched, GM Permission"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"One Time Use\/5 - Extended Action"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.48"}}

Reality Bender.embed: {"title":"Reality Bender","description":"You are able to subconsciously alter the fabric of reality to change small facts or circumstances. If your character is confronting a \"random\" event such as a die roll, coin flip, or cards being dealt, the character may activate this Feature to influence the event. In this scenario, the GM provides you with two possible outcomes, and you pick one of them to actually occur. This means you always decide the outcome of binary events such as a coin flip; cheating cards or slot machines is much harder, as there are multiple outcomes and you only get to pick between two. This Feature can also be used to generate common items worth $250 or less that the character might normally possess, such as a Potion or Pok\u00e9 Ball, when in a pinch. The character just happens to find the needed item among their belongings. This Feature can only create items you wish to use at that moment, and of which you have none available; such as needing to heal a Pok\u00e9mon but having no Potions left. Items created with Reality Bender must be used quickly after activating the feature and cannot be stored for later.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Warper, Expert Guile"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily \u2014 Free Action"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.195"}}

Major Gift - Sight Sharing.embed: {"title":"Major Gift - Sight Sharing","description":"You must take this Major Gift alongside another person also taking this Major Gift, one of you gaining it through Latias and the other through Latios. The two of you are considered Link Partners. Whenever you wish, you may share your senses with your Link Partner or attempt to use their senses as long as both you and your Link Partner give mental consent and are conscious. You and your Link Partner never hit each other with Area of Effect Moves unless you want to.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Minor Gift - Loyal Heart, See Effect"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"}],"footer":{"text":"BntD: p.59"}}

Arctic Zeal.embed:
{"title":"Arctic Zeal","description":"Your Pokémon uses the Move Mist as if it were on their Move List. When used this way, in addition to its normal effects, your Ice-Type Pokémon may expend uses of the Mist Blessing to do the following:
» As a Swift Action on their turn to cause a foe within 5 meters to take a -5 penalty to Damage Rolls and become Slowed for one full round.
» As a Free Action when being hit by a Fighting, Fire,Rock, or Steel-Typed attack dealing Super-Effective Damage to add their Tick Value to their Damage Reduction gained from Glacial Ice.
» As a Swift Action on their turn to increase their Defense or Special Defense by 1 Combat Stage.","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Glacial Ice, Type-Linked Skill at Expert"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene x2 — Free Action"},{"name":"Trigger","value":"Your Ice-Type Pokémon uses an Ice-Type Move"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.125"}}

Stat Maneuver.embed: {"title":"Stat Maneuver","description":"Stat Maneuver\u2019s Effect depends on your Chosen Stat:","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Branch]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Stat Ace, Adept Command or Focus"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Scene \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Attack Effect","value":" You may activate this Feature to cause one of your Poke\u0301mon to use a Physical \u201cMelee, 1-Target\u201d Move as if its range was \u201cMelee, Pass\u201d or \u201cMelee, 3-Targets\u201d instead."},{"name":"Defense Effect","value":" You may activate this feature whenever your Poke\u0301mon is hit by a Physical Attack to receive the blow as if your Poke\u0301mon\u2019s Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value."},{"name":"Special Attack Effect","value":" You may activate this Feature to allow your Poke\u0301mon to use a Special Burst, Cone, Close Blast, Ranged Blast, or Line of any size as a Burst 1, Cone 2, Close Blast 2, or Line 4 instead."},{"name":"Special Defense Effect","value":" You may activate this feature whenever your Poke\u0301mon is hit by a Special Attack to receive the blow as if your Poke\u0301mon\u2019s Special Defense Combat Stages were at +6 instead of their current value."},{"name":"Speed Effect","value":" You may activate this Feature at any time to cause your Poke\u0301mon to use a Move as Priority or a Priority Move as Priority (Advanced)."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.112"}}

Cinematic Analysis.embed: {"title":"Cinematic Analysis","description":"You analyze a Record in one of your Archives. Cinematic Analysis's effect depends on the Archive the Record is in. Each of these effects may only be used once per Scene.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"4 Chronicler Features, Master Perception"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Daily x3 \u2014 Free Action"},{"name":"Character Study \u2014 Profile Archive","value":" You may trigger Character Study when you or an ally makes a Charm, Command, Guile, Intimidate, or Intuition Check targeting the subject of your Record. Make a Perception Check and substitute the triggering Skill Check with the result."},{"name":"Recreation \u2014 Technique Archive","value":" Recreation may be triggered as your Pok\u00e9mon gains Initiative. Select a Record of a Move in your Technique Archive that your Pok\u00e9mon can learn by Level Up, TM, or Move Tutor. Your Pok\u00e9mon may perform that Move as if it was on its Move List. You may select a specific Move only once per day."},{"name":"Situational Awareness \u2014 Travel Archive","value":" You may only use Situational Awareness if you analyze a Record of your current Location. When used this way, you may activate it as an Interrupt. Choose an ally; that ally may take their next action as Priority (Advanced)."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.135"}}

Frozen Domain.embed: {"title":"Frozen Domain","description":"Set 6 square meters of Frozen Domain within range 6. All 6 meters must be adjacent with at least one other space of Frozen Domain. All legal targets passing through these squares must make an Acrobatics check with a DC equal to 4 + twice your Survival Rank. On failure, the target is Tripped. Pok\u00e9mon who are flying, levitating, or have the Naturewalk (Tundra) Capability are immune to this effect. When standing on a square affected by Frozen Domain, you may act as if you were in Hail weather. When a Fire-Type attack originates from or targets a square of Frozen Domain, that square of Frozen Domain melts and is cleared. Frozen Domain is considered a Hazard.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Attack or Special Attack]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Frost Touched, Expert Athletics or Survival"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.83"}}

Spirit Boost.embed: {"title":"Spirit Boost","description":"When you use Spirit Boost, choose a Channeled Pok\u00e9mon. You may choose the target of Spirit Boost if you wish. While Spirit Boost is Bound, the target has one of the following effects, depending on the highest Combat Stat of the chosen Pok\u00e9mon. (In the event of a tie, you choose which Stat to use)","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Orders][Stratagem]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Channeler"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Attack","value":"The target gains Bonus Damage when using Physical attacks equal to your Intuition Rank."},{"name":"Defense","value":"The target gains Damage Reduction against Physical attacks equal to your Intuition Rank."},{"name":"Special Attack","value":" The target gains gain Bonus Damage when using Special attacks equal to your Intuition Rank."},{"name":"Special Defense","value":" The target gains Damage Reduc- tion against Special attacks equal to your Intuition Rank."},{"name":"Speed","value":"The target gains a bonus to their Initiative equal to your Intuition Rank."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.179"}}

Dance Form.embed: {"title":"Dance Form","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Speed]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Dancer"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Static"},{"name":"Mechanic – Dance Moves","value":"Dance Moves you create with the Dance Form Feature look like the Move on the right. First, name the Dance Move whatever you like. Secondly, choose two Combat Stage gains for the effect. This may either be +2 Combat Stages to a single Stat, like Swords Dance, or +1 Combat Stage to two different Stats, like Dragon Dance. Once chosen, this cannot be changed. Dragon Dance, Quiver Dance, and Swords Dance count as Dance Moves for the purposes of Dancer Features as well. A Dance Move’s Contest Type must be chosen from a Contest Type associated with a Stat that the Dance Move affects. Cool is associated with Attack, Tough is associated with Defense, Beauty is associated with Special Attack, Smart is associated with Special Defense, and Cute is associated with Speed."}],"description":"Create and learn two Dance Moves, plus one more for each other Dancer Feature you have. Whenever you gain another Dancer Feature, create and learn another Dance Move.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.157"}}

Signature Technique.embed: {"title":"Signature Technique","fields":[{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Elite Trainer, Expert Command"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2013 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon with at least 2 Tutor Points remaining"}],"description":"The target loses 2 Tutor Points. Choose one Move on the Target\u2019s Move List. That Move becomes the target\u2019s Signature Technique, and you may apply one of the modifications listed below to the Move. The Move being modified must fit the category of the modification, and you must have the associated Training Feature to apply a modification. A Pok\u00e9mon may only have one Signature Technique at a time. If you choose to teach a Pok\u00e9mon a different Signature Technique, the old one is lost, and 1 Tutor Point is refunded. 1 Tutor Point is also refunded if the Pok\u00e9mon ever forgets a Signature Technique Move.\n\nSee ```Signature Technique List``` for more details.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.75"}}

Channeler.embed: {"title":"Channeler","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Mystic Senses"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2013 Swift Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A Pok\u00e9mon."},{"name":"Mechanic – Channeling","value":"While Channeling a Pokémon, it may communicate its intentions, emotions, and motivations to you and you may communicate similarly with them; neither party may be deceitful in this exchange. You also become aware of all of its Moves, Abilities, and Capabilities. Allied Channeled Pokémon may always attempt Intercept Maneuvers for each other, regardless of Loyalty. If you are Fainted, you stop Channeling all Pokémon. Whenever you Channel a Pokémon, you have a vague knowledge of what has happened in the Pokémon’s past hour as if they were your own memories."}],"description":"You Channel the target Pok\u00e9mon. If you attempt to Channel a Hostile Pok\u00e9mon, you must make an Intuition Check with a DC of 15 to Channel the target. You may stop Channeling a Pok\u00e9mon as a Free Action at any time. You may Channel a number of Pok\u00e9mon at a time up to your Intuition Rank. If a Channeled Pok\u00e9mon goes further than 20 meters from you, they stop being Channeled.","footer":{"text":"Core: p.179"}}

Arcanist.embed: {"title":"Arcanist","description":"You create a Soul Bond with the target Weapon. You may make a Soul Bond with only one weapon at a time. If you create a new Soul Bond, previously Soul Bound weapons lose the Bond. Soul Bound Weapons gain the following benefits:\n\u00bbIncrease the Damage Base and Effect Range of Struggle Attacks and Arcane Weapon Moves made with your Soul Bonded Weapon by +1 for each Occult Education Rank you have above Novice, up to a maximum of +3 at Master Rank.\n\u00bbAs a Shift Action, you may beckon your Soul Bonded Weapon to your hands if it is within 10 meters. If it is being held by someone else who does not want to let go of the weapon, make an Occult vs Athletics Opposed Check. If you win, they their lose grip on your Weapon and it flies to your hand as normal","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Class][+Special Attack][Weapon]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Arcane Training"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"At-Will \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"An Arcane Weapon"}],"footer":{"text":"GoT: p.54"}}

Mark of Vision.embed: {"title":"Mark of Vision","description":"You mark the target with a mystical power which allows you to close your eyes and focus to perceive the world with their senses from their perspective. You may Bind this Ability multiple times, each time on a different target, but you may only concentrate on one Mark of Vision at a time, and you may only have a number of Marks at one time equal to half your Perception Rank. A target may choose to end this effect at any time, or to deny you access to their senses temporarily without ending the effect entirely. You have a rough sense of how far away and in what direction marked targets are.","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[+Special Defense]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Oracle, Adept Perception"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"Bind 1 AP \u2014 Extended Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"A willing Trainer"}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.186"}}

Stat Stratagem.embed: {"title":"Stat Stratagem","description":"While this Feature is Bound, the target has the following bonuses based on your Chosen Stat:","fields":[{"name":"Tags","value":"[Branch][Order][Strategem]"},{"name":"Prerequisites","value":"Stat Link, Stat Training, Master Focus or Command"},{"name":"Frequency","value":"2 AP \u2014 Standard Action"},{"name":"Target","value":"Your Pok\u00e9mon"},{"name":"Attack Effect","value":" The target\u2019s damaging Melee Attacks have their Critical Hit Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Attack, up to a maximum of +3."},{"name":"Defense Effect","value":" The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Paralysis, Sleep, and Freeze for each positive Combat Stage they have in Defense, up to a maximum of +6."},{"name":"Special Attack Effect","value":" The target\u2019s damaging Ranged Attacks have their Effect Range increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Attack, up to a maximum of +3."},{"name":"Special Defense Effect","value":" The target gains a +2 bonus to Save Checks against Confusion, Rage, and Infatuation for each positive Combat Stage they have in Special Defense, up to a maximum of +6."},{"name":"Speed Effect","value":" The target\u2019s Movement Capabilities are increased by 1 for each positive Combat Stage they have in Speed, up to a maximum of +3."}],"footer":{"text":"Core: p.113"}}
